titles.title: A bill to waive application of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act to a specific parcel of real property transferred by the United States to 2 Indian tribes in the State of Oregon, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Dorgan without amendment. With written report No. 110-44.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 109.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 178.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 110-276.
Mrs. Christensen asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

bill.summary: 8/13/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the Senate reported version is repeated here.) Waives application of the Indian Self Determination and Education Assistance Act to a specified parcel of real property transferred by the United States to the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians of Oregon and the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to issue a new deed to the Tribes to such parcel that shall not include: (1) any restriction on the right to alienate the parcel; or (2) any reference to any provision of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. Prohibits Class II and Class III gaming under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act on such real property.
